sen.j: 源 義清（みなもと の よしきよ）は平安時代末期の武将。
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshikiyo was a busho (Japanese military commander) who lived in the end of the Heian period.
MINAMOTO no Yoshikiyo was a Busho (Japanese military commander) who lived during the end of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: capitalized "Busho"; changed "in" to "during"
sen.e: MINAMOTO no Yoshikiyo was a Busho (Japanese military commander) who lived during the end of the Heian period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 足利氏の祖である源義康の庶長子。
sen.e: He was the eldest child born out of wedlock of MINAMOTO no Yoshiyasu who was the patriarch of the Ashikaga clan.
He was the eldest child born out of wedlock of MINAMOTO no Yoshiyasu, the patriarch of the Ashikaga clan.
sen.cmt: eliminated "who was" and used a comma to lessen ambiguity
sen.e: He was the eldest child born out of wedlock of MINAMOTO no Yoshiyasu, the patriarch of the Ashikaga clan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 通称を矢田判官代といい、足利義清、矢田義清とも記される。
sen.e: He was commonly called Yada no Hangandai (assistant officer who served an administration organization called Innocho) and also written as Yoshikiyo ASHIKAGA and Yoshikiyo YADA.
He was commonly called Yada no Hangandai (assistant officer serving an administrative organization called Innocho) but also referred to as Yoshikiyo ASHIKAGA and Yoshikiyo YADA.
sen.cmt: changed "and also written as" to "but also referred to as"; changed "administration" to "administrative"
sen.e: He was commonly called Yada no Hangandai (assistant officer serving an administrative organization called Innocho) but also referred to as Yoshikiyo ASHIKAGA and Yoshikiyo YADA.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.e: He was the patriarch of the Hosokawa clan and the Niki clan.
He was the patriarch of the Hosokawa and Niki clans.
sen.cmt: pluralized "clan"; fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: He was the patriarch of the Hosokawa and Niki clans.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同母弟は足利義長、異母弟に足利義兼・足利義房。
sen.e: His brother was Yoshinaga ASHIKAGA and his half brothers were Yoshikane ASHIKAGA and Yoshifusa ASHIKAGA.
Yoshikiyo's brother was Yoshinaga ASHIKAGA and his half brothers were Yoshikane ASHIKAGA and Yoshifusa ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: changed the first "His" to "Yoshikiyo" since this is a new section and paragraph;
sen.e: Yoshikiyo's brother was Yoshinaga ASHIKAGA and his younger paternal half-brothers were Yoshikane ASHIKAGA and Yoshifusa ASHIKAGA.
sen.cmt: 異母弟 を追加しました。

sen.j: 長男であったが妾腹のために、本拠の足利庄を嫡出である異母弟の義兼に譲って、自らは平安京において統子内親王に仕える。
sen.e: Since he was the eldest son born out of wedlock, he gave their home Ashikagasho district to his half brother Yoshikane and served for Imperial Princess Muneko at Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto).

Since he was the eldest son but born out of wedlock, Yoshikiyo gave his home in the Ashikagasho district to his half brother, Yoshikane, and served for Imperial Princess Muneko at Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto).
sen.cmt: added "but" before "born out of wedlock" to coincide with "長男であったが妾腹"; changed "he" to "Yoshikiyo" for better clarity; added commas around "Yoshikane"
sen.e: Since he was the eldest son but born out of wedlock, Yoshikiyo gave his home in the Ashikagasho district to his younger paternal half-brother, Yoshikane, and served for Imperial Princess Muneko at Heian-kyo (the ancient capital of Japan in current Kyoto).
sen.cmt: 異母弟 を追加しました。

sen.j: 治承4年（1180年）の以仁王の挙兵に際しては源頼政と行動をともにし、頼政が敗死した後は源義仲の麾下に走る。
sen.e: At the time of rising of Prince Mochihito in 1180, he went along with MINAMOTO no Yorimasa and joined the troops under Yoshinaka's command after Yorimasa's death.

In 1180 when Prince Mochihito was raising an army, Yoshikiyo mobilized together with MINAMOTO no Yorimasa, and after Yorimasa was defeated he joined the troops under the command of MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka.
sen.cmt: changed "rising of Prince Mochihito" to "Prince Mochihito was raising an army" for "以仁王の挙兵"; fixed to read more understandably
sen.e: In 1180 when Prince Mochihito was raising an army, Yoshikiyo mobilized together with MINAMOTO no Yorimasa, and after Yorimasa was defeated he joined the troops under the command of MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 寿永2年（1183年）の平家都落ちの際、源行家や多田行綱と共に京都を包囲し、丹波路から大江山に布陣して都の西方から平家を追いつめ、7月に義仲軍と共に入京した。
sen.e: When the Taira family exiled from the capital in 1183, he surrounded Kyoto with MINAMOTO no Yukiie and Yukitsuna TADA, tracked down them with placing the battle line from Tanbaji (Tanba road) to Mt. Oe, and entered in Kyoto with the Yoshinaka's army on July.

When the Taira family fled the capital in 1183, Yoshikiyo's troops surrounded Kyoto along with MINAMOTO no Yukiie and Yukitsuna TADA, and after making a battle formation from Tanbaji (Tanba road) to Mt. Oe, they tracked down the Taira family to the west of the city and entered Kyoto with Yoshinaka's army in July.
sen.cmt: changed "exiled" to "fled" for "都落ち"; changed "he" to "Yoshikiyo" for better clarity; added "along" before "with"; added "troops" for better clarity; rearranged sentence to read more understandably; fixed grammar
sen.e: When the Taira family fled the capital in 1183, Yoshikiyo's troops surrounded Kyoto along with MINAMOTO no Yukiie and Yukitsuna TADA, and after making a battle formation from Tanbaji (Tanba road) to Mt. Oe, they tracked down the Taira family from the west of the city and entered Kyoto with Yoshinaka's army in July.
sen.cmt: from the west としました。

sen.j: 同年10月、西海にあった平氏を追討するべく、義仲の代官（総大将）として海野幸広とともに一軍を率いて京を出発。
sen.e: On October in the same year, in order to hunt down and kill the Taira clan in the Saikai (provinces on the western seacoast), he left Kyoto leading troops as the supreme commander of Yoshinaka's army with Yukihiro UNNO.

During October of the same year, in order to hunt down and kill the Taira clan in Saikai (provinces on the western seacoast), Yoshikiyo left Kyoto leading troops as the supreme commander of Yoshinaka's army with Yukihiro UNNO.
sen.cmt: changed "On" to "During"; changed "in" to "of"; changed "he" to "Yoshikiyo"
sen.e: During October of the same year, in order to hunt down and kill the Taira clan in Saikai (provinces on the western seacoast), Yoshikiyo left Kyoto leading troops as the supreme commander of Yoshinaka's army with Yukihiro UNNO.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同年11月17日、備中国水島（現在の岡山県倉敷市玉島付近）において、本隊の平知盛・平重衡と、搦手の平通盛・平教経ら率いる平氏軍と激突した。
sen.e: On January 8, 1184, he fought with the Taira clan army which consisted of the main force led by TAIRA no Tomomori and TAIRA no Shigehira and the backdoor troop led by TAIRA no Michimori and TAIRA no Noritsune at Mizushima region, Bicchu Province (the present Tamashima region, Kurashiki City, Okayama Prefecture).

On January 8, 1184, Yoshikiyo fought against the Taira clan's army, consisting of a main force led by TAIRA no Tomomori and TAIRA no Shigehira, and a rearguard troop led by TAIRA no Michimori and TAIRA no Noritsune in the Mizushima region, Bicchu Province (the present Tamashima region, Kurashiki City, Okayama Prefecture).
sen.cmt: changed "he" to "Yoshikiyo" for better clarity; fixed grammar to read more understandably
sen.e: On January 8, 1184, Yoshikiyo fought against the Taira clan's army, consisting of a main force led by TAIRA no Tomomori and TAIRA no Shigehira, and a rearguard troop led by TAIRA no Michimori and TAIRA no Noritsune in the Mizushima region, Bicchu Province (the present Tamashima region, Kurashiki City, Okayama Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 総大将の義清は船戦に慣れた平氏軍を前に大敗を喫し、海野幸広や同母弟の義長らとともに矢の雨に浴びせられて、壮絶な戦死を遂げた（水島の戦い）。
sen.e: The supreme commander Yoshikiyo suffered a crushing defeat by the Taira clan army who got used to fight on a ship, and was killed in a fierce battle of a barrage of falling arrows altogether as well as Yukihiro UNNO, his brother Yoshinaga and so on (the battle at Mizushima).

Yoshikiyo suffered a crushing defeat as supreme commander by the Taira clan's army who were accustomed to fighting on ships, and along with Yukihiro UNNO, his brother Yoshinaga and many others, he was killed in a fierce battle from a barrage of falling arrows (the battle at Mizushima).
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more smoothly; fixed grammar
sen.e: Yoshikiyo suffered a crushing defeat as supreme commander by the Taira clan's army who were accustomed to fighting on ships, and along with Yukihiro UNNO, his younger paternal half-brother Yoshinaga and many others, he was killed in a fierce battle from a barrage of falling arrows (the battle at Mizushima).
sen.cmt: 異母弟 を追加しました。
